children.text:
Now, handling the array in Fortran. First the array: declare an integer array of size N.

So in code:

program main

implicit none

integer :: N, count=0, i,j

integer, allocatable :: L(:)

read(*,*) N

allocate( L(N) )

read(*,*) L

call sort_list(L)

then loop through i and j.

Now, for the sorting: need a subroutine to sort the array.
children.label: high_level_plan

children.text:
Let's code that as a subroutine. Subroutine:

subroutine sort_list(arr)
integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)
integer :: i,j,tmp, n
n = size(arr) do j = 2, n
    tmp = arr(j)
    i = j -1
    do while (i >=1 .and. arr(i) > tmp)
        arr(i+1) = arr(i) i = i -1
    end do
    arr(i+1) = tmp
end do
end subroutine

Alternatively, use a bubble sort, but insertion sort may be okay.

program main

implicit none

integer :: n, count, i,j, a_b_sum, from, temp

    integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

    n = size(arr)

    do j=2, n

children.label: empty

arr(i) > temp )

            i = i-1 

        end do 

        arr(i+1) = temp 

    end do 

end subroutine sort_list

! Define the find function 

integer function find(li, from_val, target_val)

    integer, intent(in) :: li(:)
    integer, intent(in) :: from_val, target_val 

    integer :: low, upper, mid, tmp 

    low = from_val 
    upper = size(li)

    tmp = upper - low +1 

    if ( upper < low ) then 

        find =0 

        return 

    end if 

    if ( li(low) >= target_val ) then 

        find =0 

        return 

    end if 

    if ( li(upper) < target_val ) then 

        find = upper - low +1 

        return 

    end if 

    ! Else, perform binary search 

    do while ( upper - low >1 ) 

        ! compute mid 

        if ( mod( (upper - low +1 ), 2) ==0 ) then 

            mid = (low + upper)/2 +1 

        else 

            mid = (low + upper)/2 

        end if 

        if ( li(mid) >= target_val ) then 

            upper = mid 

        else 

            low = mid 

        end if 

    end do 

    ! After loop, compute the count 

    find = low - from_val +1 

end function find 

end program main

subroutine sort_list(arr)
integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)
integer :: i,j,tmp, n
n = size(arr)
do j = 2, n
    tmp = arr(j)
    i = j -1
    do while (i >=1 .and. arr(i) > tmp)
        arr(i+1) = arr(i)
        i = i -1
    end do
    arr(i+1) = tmp
end do
end subroutine

Wait for instance, when j is N. Then j+1 is N+1 which exceeds the array length N, so from_val is N+1. In that case, in the Java code, find would return zero, since j+1 exceeds the list's indices, as low=from_val would be > upp (since upper is N). 

Hence, we can guard against that in the code, to skip if from_val > N, but in the program's code, after computing from_val, before calling the find function, check that from_val <= N.

Now, writing this in Fortran:

(Note: Fortran uses 4 spaces or tabs; the syntax is case-insensitive and can be organized with good indentation.)

Putting this all together, here's the code outline.

First, the main program:

program main

implicit none

integer :: n, count, i,j, a_b_sum, from, temp
integer, allocatable :: L(:)

! Read N

read(*,*) n 

allocate(L(n))

! Read array elements

read(*,*) L

! Sort the array

call sort_list(L)

count = 0 

do i=1, n-1 

    do j = i+1, n 

        a_val = L(i)

        b_val = L(j)

        a_b_sum = a_val + b_val 

        from = j +1 

        if ( from > n ) then  ! No elements to consider 

            cycle 

        end if 

        ! Find number of elements >= from and < a_b_sum 

        temp = find(L, from, a_b_sum )

        count = count + temp 

    end do 

end do 

write(*,*) count 

contains 

! Define the Sort routine 

subroutine sort_list(arr)

    integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)

    integer :: i,j, n, temp 

    n = size(arr)

    do j=2, n 

        temp = arr(j)

        i = j-1

        do while( i >=1 .and. arr(i) > temp )

            arr(i+1) = arr(i)

            i = i-1 

        end do 

        arr(i+1) = temp 

    end do 

end subroutine sort_list

! Define the find function 

integer function find(li, from_val, target_val)

    integer, intent(in) :: li(:)
    integer, intent(in) :: from_val, target_val 

    integer :: low, upper, mid, tmp 

    low = from_val 
    upper = size(li)

    tmp = upper - low +1 

    if ( upper < low ) then 

        find =0 

        return 

    end if 

    if ( li(low) >= target_val ) then 

        find =0 

        return 

    end if 

    if ( li(upper) < target_val ) then 

        find = upper - low +1 

        return 

    end if 

    ! Else, perform binary search 

    do while ( upper - low >1 ) 

        ! compute mid 

        if ( mod( (upper - low +1 ), 2) ==0 ) then 

            mid = (low + upper)/2 +1 

        else 

            mid = (low + upper)/2 

        end if 

        if ( li(mid) >= target_val ) then 

            upper = mid 

        else 

            low = mid 

        end if 

    end do 

    ! After loop, compute the count 

    find = low - from_val +1 

end function find 

end program main
